intro: Cuphea panamensis, commonly known as Panama cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Cuphea panamensis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
